member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.ChartType
member.summary: Gets or sets the chart type. Available types are Area, Bar, Pie, Scatter, Line and Column.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.RadialLabels
member.summary: This property only applies to Pie charts. It causes the field to add radial labels attached to the pie slices instead of a legend.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.ShowPercentages
member.summary: This property only applies to Pie charts. It causes the field to add percentage labels to the pie slices.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.RecordSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a Sql statement to use and retrieve data for the chart.
member.remarks: If provided, data is retrieved using the parent report's ConnectionString. If omitted, data is retrieved directly from the parent report. In this latter case, the data is automatically filtered according to the current grouping scope (e.g. a chart in a 'Category' group header would contain data only for the current category).

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.DataX
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing one field with the chart labels.
member.remarks: Labels are displayed along the X axis or along with pie slices. For example: chartField.DataX = "ProductName"

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.DataY
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing one or more fields with the data to plot on the chart.
member.remarks: If multiple fields are provided, they must be separated with semicolons. For example: chartField.DataY = "UnitPrice;UnitsInStock" You can also use regular VBScript expressions instead of simple field names. For example, to plot sales and sales taxes as two separate series, you could use: chartField.DataY = "Sales;Sales * 0.085"

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.DataYLabels
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string containing text labels to use for .
If null or empty, field names specified by are used.
If multiple labels are provided, they must be separated with semicolons. For example: chartField.DataYLabels = "Unit Price;Units In Stock"

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.DataColor
member.summary: Specifies the color for the chart bars, lines, symbols, or pie slices.
member.remarks: If the chart contains more than one series (or pie slices) then additional colors are generated automatically by making the base color lighter. To control the color of each series in a multi-series chart, use the property instead.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.Palette
member.summary: Specifies a collection of colors to be used for each series (or pie slices).
member.remarks: The collection is specified as a string containing a list of color names, delimited by semicolons. For example: chartField.Palette = "Red;Green;Blue"

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.GridLines
member.summary: Adds gridlines to charts. This property does not apply to Pie charts.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.Boxed
member.summary: Draws a box around the plot area.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.Use3D
member.summary: Applies 3D effects to the charts.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.XMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value for the X axis.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.XMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value for the X axis.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.YMin
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum value for the Y axis.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.YMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value for the Y axis.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.FormatX
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotation format for the X axis.
member.remarks:
This property controls the format used to display values along the X axis of the chart.
The value is a regular .NET format string that is used to format numeric or values. For details on how to specify format strings, see the interface.
Typical values used for formatting numeric values are "F2" (floating point with two decimals), "C" (currency), and "#,##0.00" (thousand-separated values with two decimals). See also C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.AnnoFormat.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.FormatY
member.summary: Gets or sets the annotation format for the Y axis.
member.remarks:
This property controls the format used to display values along the Y axis of the chart.
The value is a regular .NET format string that is used to format numeric or values. For details on how to specify format strings, see the interface.
Typical values used for formatting numeric values are "F2" (floating point with two decimals), "C" (currency), and "#,##0.00" (thousand-separated values with two decimals). See also C1.Win.C1Chart.Axis.AnnoFormat.

member.summary: Gets or sets the starting angle of Radar and Polar chart.
member.remarks: The angle is measured in degrees if the Degrees property is true, radians otherwise. The angle is measured in the counter-clockwise direction from the 12 o'clock position.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.CircularOptions.Degrees
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Start value reflects angles in degrees (true) or radians (false) for Radar and Polar chart.

member.name: T:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.RadarOptions
member.summary: Represents the options for Radar chart.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.RadarOptions.Filled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Radar chart should be filled.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.RadarOptions.FlatGridLines
member.summary: Gets or sets whether Radar chart should use flat Y coordinate gridlines. By default, Y coordinate gridlines are circular.

member.summary: Represents the options for Polar chart.

member.name: T:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.HistogramOptions
member.summary: Represents the options for Histogram chart.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.HistogramOptions.Normalized
member.summary: Gets or sets whether each histogram series interval is normalized.
member.remarks: When histograms with non-uniform intervals are generated, each interval is typically normalized such that each interval height represents the same frequency per unit width. This preserves the most appropriate histogram shape.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.HistogramOptions.NormalizationInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the normalization interval width.
member.remarks: When histograms with non-uniform intervals are generated, each interval is typically normalized such that each interval height represents the same frequency per unit width. This preserves the most appropriate histogram shape. The normalization interval width is the width to which all other intervals are normalized. Intervals with the same width as the normalization width, will have a height which directly indicates its value.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.HistogramOptions.NormalDisplay
member.summary: Gets or sets an object describing a Gaussian normal curve display.
member.remarks: Histograms and frequency graphs are used to show the distribution of data values. Very often, the data distributions are compared to normal distributions. The properties of the NormalCurve object control the appearance of a built in display of a Normal (Gaussian) curve for comparison. The normal curve is unrelated to the data.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.HistogramOptions.DisplayType
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to display the frequency data.
member.remarks: Frequency data can be displayed in a different manner on a per series basis, making it possible to mix display types in a single chart group.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.HistogramOptions.IntervalCreationMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the method used to specify the histogram intervals.
member.remarks:
Interval boundaries can be established in a variety of ways.
When the Automatic method is used, the chart calculates the upper and lower limits of the intervals using the maximum and minimum data values, and restricting the intervals to lie within 3 standard deviations of the data mean. The number of intervals is optional. Interval boundaries are calculated uniformly.
When the SemiAutomatic method is used, the upper and lower limits of the intervals are specified together with the number of intervals. Interval boundaries are calculated uniformly.
When the XDataBoundaries method is used, the X values of the data data series are used to explicitly set each interval boundary. The X values are sorted and duplicate values are eliminated. Each ascending value of the result is used determine the next interval boundary. Thus, the first and second resulting X values define the first interval and each successive X value specifies the end of the next interval. Note that specification of N intervals requires N+1 unique X values.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.HistogramOptions.IntervalNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of intervals in the histogram.
member.remarks: The IntervalNumber property applies only to histograms created with Automatic and SemiAutomatic methods. When the XDataBoundaries method is used, the number of intervals is defined as 1 less than the number of unique X values specified.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.HistogramOptions.IntervalStart
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric value of the beginning of the first interval.
member.remarks: Applies only to the SemiAutomatic creation method.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.HistogramOptions.IntervalWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the numeric value of the width of the each interval.
member.remarks: Applies only to the SemiAutomatic creation method.

member.name: T:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.NormalCurve
member.summary: Represents the appearance of the normal curve for the Histogram chart.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.NormalCurve.ForegroundDisplay
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Normal (Gaussian) curve is displayed on top of the chart data display.
member.remarks: By default, the Normal (Gaussian) curve is displayed behind all charted data. Setting the ForegroundDisplay property to true specifies that the Normal curve should be drawn on top of the charted data.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.NormalCurve.LineStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the LineStyle object for the Normal curve.
member.remarks: The LineStyle property controls the appearance of the actual line drawn representing the Normal curve. The FillStyle property controls the appearance of the area under the Normal curve.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.NormalCurve.FillStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the FillStyle object for the Normal curve.
member.remarks: The FillStyle property controls the appearance of the area under the Normal curve. The LineStyle property controls the appearance of the actual line drawn representing the Normal curve.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.NormalCurve.UseAntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Normal curve is drawn using anti-aliasing.
member.remarks: By default, the normal curve is drawn using anti-aliasing methods. Setting the UseAntiAlias property to false overrides this behavior.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Chart.NormalCurve.Visible
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Normal curve is drawn.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Maps.LayerBase.PointsLocationExpressions
member.summary: Gets the list of lists of location expressions. The outer list corresponds to the point or points associated with each record of the layer - i.e. for a points layer, that list will contain one element, for lines - two etc. The inner list for each point is the collection of location expressions. E.g. it can be Country, City, Address.

member.summary: Gets or sets the current layer's caption. Used to represent the layer in legends.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Maps.LayerBase.RecordSource
member.summary: Gets or sets an SQL statement used to retrieve data for the layer.
member.remarks: If provided, data is retrieved using the parent report's ConnectionString. If omitted, data is retrieved directly from the parent report. In this latter case, the data is automatically filtered according to the current grouping scope (e.g. a layer in a 'Category' group header would contain data only for the current category).

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Maps.KmlLayer.varItemName
member.summary: The string "kmlItemName" used in KmlLayer's expressions will be replaced with the actual quoted KML item name at runtime prior to expression's evaluation. E.g. the following expression could be used to check for the country: Country=kmlItemName (note the absense of quotes around kmlName).

member.summary:
Gets or sets a filter string applied to the layer's . When KML data is loaded into the layer, for each item being loaded this filter is applied to the layer data, and item expressions (, , ) are evaluated in the context of the first data row matching the filter.
NOTE: this only works if a custom is specified for the KML layer.

member.name: T:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Maps.Legend
member.summary:
Represents a map legend - an area on a containing a list of items derived from . The following item types are supported:
Represents a map layer or layer style. Shows the layer's marker or line, and a descriptive text (the layer's caption by default).
Shows a color swatch, and a descriptive text.
Shows an arbitrary text.

member.name: T:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Maps.LegendLayerStyleItem
member.summary:
Represents a legend item describing a map layer or a layer style.
The layer may belong to a different map in the report. This may be used to place a legend outside the map's bounds for instance.
If no layer or style is associated with the legend item, arbitrary markers, colors etc may be selected.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.GeoCachePath
member.summary:
Gets or sets the path to the file used to cache spatial coordinates (longitude/latitude) specified as MapLocation rather than actual Longitude/Latitude values. The coordinates in such cases are retrieved using an online service such as Google, and caching them significantly imporoves performance when the same location is encountered multiple times.
The path is relative to the application startup path.
The default is "geocache.xml".
Clear this value to disable caching (not recommended).

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.Layers
member.summary:
Gets the collection of layers containing markers, lines and KML data rendered on the map.
Note that the set accessor is only for deserialization, and should not be used directly.

member.summary:
Gets the collection of legends rendered on the map. Legends may represent layers or arbitrary information (such as captions).
Note that the set accessor is only for deserialization, and should not be used directly.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.MarkerStyles
member.summary:
Gets the collection of styles used to render markers on the map. Styles allow markers in different layers or even in different maps to use common visual properties.

member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the map should automatically zoom in to just include all spatial data. Ignored (considered to be false) if AutoCenter is false.
The default is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.AutoCenter
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to automatically center the map around the spatial data. Note that setting this property to false effectively turns off AutoZoom.
The default is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.AutoZoomPadLon
member.summary:
Gets or sets auto zoom longitude padding, in percent relative to the viewport width.
The default is 10%.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.AutoZoomPadLat
member.summary:
Gets or sets auto zoom latitude padding, in percent relative to the viewport height.
The default is 10%.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.ZoomLevel
member.summary:
Gets or sets the zoom level value. 0 is no zoom, 1 - x2 zoom and so on. Valid values are from 0 to 20.
The default is 0. Ignored if is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.MaxAutoZoom
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum zoom level value for auto zooming. Valid values are from 0 to 20. 0 (the default) disables auto zoom limiting.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.RoundAutoZoom
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to round automatically calculated zoom levels down to next integer.
The default is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.CenterLongitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the map center longitude. Ignored if AutoCenter is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.CenterLatitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the map center latitude. Ignored if AutoCenter is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.Map.TargetDpi

member.summary: Select encoding automatically based on the content.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.QRCode.EncodingEnum.AlphaNumeric
member.summary: Encode up to 395 alpha-numeric values. Alpha-numeric values include digits from 0 to 9, uppercase letters from A to Z, space, and the following additional characters: dollar, percentage, asterisk, plus, minus, slash, and colon ([0-9][A-Z][$%*+-./:]).

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.QRCode.EncodingEnum.Byte
member.summary: Encode up to 271 bytes.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.QRCode.EncodingEnum.Numeric
member.summary: Encode up to 652 numeric values.

member.name: T:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.QRCode.ErrorCorrectionLevelEnum

For more details see C1.Win.C1BarCode.ErrorCorrectionLevel.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.QRCode.ErrorCorrectionLevelEnum.L
member.summary: Able to correct up to 7% damage.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.QRCode.ErrorCorrectionLevelEnum.M
member.summary: Able to correct up to 15% damage.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.QRCode.ErrorCorrectionLevelEnum.Q

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.CustomFields.QRCode.ErrorCorrectionLevelEnum.H
